title: Ex-GS banker's zest for Pepper
text:
Pepper Group co-chiefs Patrick Tuttle and Mike Culhane may have a new recruit. Sasha Woolley by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell Ex-Goldman Sachs banker Simon Hotchkin is believed to be headed to recently-listed Pepper Group.
Sources said Hotchkin was in talks with Pepper but was yet to sign a formal agreement.
He finished at Goldman in June where he was an executive director, focusing on credit origination, structuring and distribution. Hotchkin has experience in debt securitisation, which is a key focus for Pepper.
Shares in Pepper surged by 27 per cent on the company's ASX debut last Friday .
The non-bank lender attracted strong demand after its offer price was lowered to 10 times forecast net profit from 12 times.
Pepper expects to generate net profit growth of 34 per cent to $47 million in calendar year 2015.
Elsewhere, former Investec executive director Hiro Shimada is headed to Japanese investment bank Nomura.
Street Talk revealed last week Shimada had left Investec, along with director Henry Foster, property fund manager Matthew Liston and a number of junior staff.
 Sources said well-regarded Investec managing director Colin Young may also be heading for the exit.
